channel.title: Thoughts on Windows 8?
channel.description: I've been seeing a lot of debate about this, wanted to see what some of the Moparscape members thought on this topic. With Windows 8 here as promised by Microsoft, it isn't looking too bad so far. Personally, I think it looks great on the new Microsoft Surface device, it's perfect for tablets. I also believe that it may work nicely on some larger 4-inch screen sized phones, otherwise it would probably be too cramped. I think it's pretty nice for touch screen devices but when they try to implement it, or use it on computers, it just turns out horrible. This all is from personal experience, I've also noticed that it seems to take up quite a bit of memory. What are your thoughts on this topic everyone? Everyone is welcome to at least post their thoughts.

item.title: Thoughts on Windows 8?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Turmoilz1337x:

I think windows wasn’t ready for such a “drastic” change in software. I mean, it’s not perfected, it’s not adapted to, and it’s rather buggy. Also, it’s getting more and more complicated to understand how to use things. Not for me personally, but taking it from people who don’t have computer hobbies or as much time. (Parents, 40 hour a week workers, grandparents, etc.) I think window should perfect, speed and feature wise, their current systems and only release minor updates. IE, buy windows 7 and get free downloads of windows 7.005, 7.1, etc. eventually releasing windows 8 as a perfect version of 7 with slightly more features. Building upon it, not changing it all around. It can be easier to switch from Windows to IOS than Windows 7 to 8.

It seems as if it was designed more to suite tablets the boxes are just weird to click on I feel like you need to tap them with your finger to get the full effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on Windows 8?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:11, topic:466163”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=577533.msg4145123#msg4145123 date=1352164634]

It sends everything you do to microsoft,
you can even find it in the configuration,
but even when disabled it keeps sending all your data.

Really? Never knew that.
[/quote]
I cant tell if you’re being sarcastic, but if not, this is very true. Its one of the ‘Big Things’ in Win8.[/quote]

I wasn’t being sarcastic, I actually didn’t know that… Haha, that’s pretty sad.

Read full topic
